Description: Mould-made pottery oil-lamp with a round nozzle and handle projecting from a discus shaped body. At the rear is an Egyptian ring handle. Red brown Nile silt (?) fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Chautauqua Institution, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Isdentification based upon description and sketch. See British Museum 1888,0601.143 for an example of this type.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.66) (Phase 3)
